front.text: Hi, can I call you back?

back.translation: No mucho. Me quedaré en casa.

front.text: Have you seen any good movies lately?
front.ipa: /hæv jə sin ˈɛni ɡʊd ˈmuːviz ˈleɪtli?/

front.text: Yeah, I watched a great one last week
front.ipa: /jæ, aɪ wɑʧt ə ɡreɪt wʌn læst wik/

back.translation: Sí, vi una excelente la semana pasada.

front.text: Saw a decent one, nothing special.
What do you do for fun?
Usually I watch movies for fun
What kind of music do you listen to?
front.ipa: /wʌt kaɪnd əv ˈmjuzɪk du jə ˈlɪsən tə?/

back.translation: Me gusta el rock and roll.

front.text: What did you do last night?
I went out with a friend
Did you catch the game last night?
front.ipa: /dɪd jə kæʧ ðə ɡeɪm læst naɪt?/

front.text: What's your plan for the weekend?

back.translation: ¿Cuál es tu plan para el fin de semana?

front.text: Probably just gonna relax at home
How do you get to work?

back.translation: Conduzco la mayoría de los días.

front.text: What do you do for a living?
front.ipa: /wʌt dʊ jə du fər ə ˈlɪvɪŋ?/
/aɪ hæv tuː ˈbrʌðərz ənd θriː ˈsɪstərz/

front.text: I have no brothers or sisters
What did you do this weekend?

back.translation: Tuve un gran fin de semana.
Tuve un fin de semana relajante.

front.text: How many children do you have?
Yes, I would like a glass of water
front.ipa: /jɛs, aɪ wʊd laɪk ə ɡlæs əv ˈwɔtər/

back.translation: Sí, me gustaría un vaso de agua.

front.text: Thank you, I'm looking for new shoes.
front.ipa: /θæŋk ju, aɪm ˈlʊkɪŋ fər nju ʃuz/

front.text: Hi, are you ready to order?
I was at the grocery store
